text: Hey, all! Ry is out this week on vacation, so if you have any CI issues, please ping me here, or send an email to <mailto:helpdesk@hyperledger.org|helpdesk@hyperledger.org>!
thanks <@U1BC5NF2S>
waves at <@U1BC5NF2S|bramwelt> - I think we need to discuss a cut-over to Gerrit and Jira for Fabric
Gerrit is ready, I am unclear on the status of Jira
<@U0KM61BCP>: <https://jira.hyperledger.org> appears to be up. Looks like only one issue has been created and that is for Sawtooth.
ah cool
there’s a process to import issues from GH… I need to chase that down, unless you have something you’ve used before for other projects
sounds like the pieces are in place
most projects rarely, if ever, port in their issue tracking. But that's because most projects don't start in github and then migrate to gerrit...
we just need to get the maintainers agreeing to the cutover date/time and be sure that LF are willing and prepared to execute
ok, well, since we’ll be locking down GH repos to serve only as mirrors, I think we need to affect the import
<@U1BC5NF2S>: <https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-data-from-github-802592903.html>
<@U1BC5NF2S>: ack, we on the sawtooth team got setup late last week with help from <@U0UHG4VP1>
on Jira
<@U1F97K1UJ> sweet
<@U1F97K1UJ>: Good to hear!

<@U0KM61BCP>: I'd think the best time to cut over would be on a weekend? But that's definitely something to discuss with Ry as he should be managing the migration. I wouldn't want to schedule something for him. :slightly_smiling_face:
We have the f2f Tuesday and Wednesday… think Monday might be ideal
so that we have Tues and Weds to address any remedial training and questions
<@U0KM61BCP>: Sounds good to me.
<@U0KM61BCP>: Looking into the Jira issue import now.
Never used this so...we'll see what happens
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/projects/FAB/issues/FAB-2246?filter=allissues>
Not sure if this was very helpful...
Seems to have imported the PRs as well
yes. I could see list of  PR's and Issues..
ramesh: Sorry I was a bit trigger happy on merging in your changes. That should be 'junit' not 'cucumber-results' for the publisher :slightly_smiling_face:
<http://docs.openstack.org/infra/jenkins-job-builder/publishers.html#publishers.junit>
<@U1BC5NF2S>: hmmm that isn’t very helpful - sigh
not you, I mean the script
<@U1BC5NF2S>: Forgot to change the publisher name to junit.. submitted new patch..
